titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Donald D. Van Slyke papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA203

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-11-22 09:45:31 -0500.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Donald D. Van Slyke papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biography; bibliography; photographs; administrative correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Donald Dexter Van Slyke, 1883-1971, biological chemist at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research from 1907 to 1948 when he became Emeritus and worked at Brookhaven National Laboratory until his death in 1971.

His work was chiefly in the chemistry of proteins and protein derivatives and their role in physiology, pathology, enzyme action, blood chemistry and the metabolic conditions of diabetes and nephritis. Co-author with Peters of 2 volumes "Qualitative Clinical Chemistry".

eventgrp.event: Born March 29, Pike, New York
Hobart College, Geneva, New York
A.B. University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan
Ph. D. University of Michigan
Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York Fellow in Chemistry with P.A.T. Levene
RIMR Assistant in Chemistry
University of Berlin, studied with Emil Fischer
RIMR Associate Member
RIMR Hospital Associate Member, Chief chemist
Visiting Professor University of California
RIMR Hospital Member
Visiting Professor Peking Medical College
Member Emeritus RIMR
Brookhaven National Laboratory, Asst. Dir. for Research in Biology and Medicine
Brookhaven National Laboratory, Research Chemist
Died May 4, Garden City, New York
Sc. D. Yale University
Sc. D. University of Michigan
M.D. University of Oslo
Sc. D. Northwestern University
Sc. D. University of Chicago
Sc. D. University of London
M.D. University of Amsterdam
Sc. D. Rockefeller University
M.D. University of Ulm
Charles Mickle Fellowship. University of Toronto
Phillip A. Conne Medal. Chemist's Club of New York
Willard Gibbs Medal. Chicago Section American Chemical Society
Order of the Jade Republic of China
Kober Medal. Association of American Physicians
Order of the Brilliant Star. Republic of China
Fisher Award in Analytical Chemistry. American Chemical Society
John Phillips Memorial Award. American College of Physicians
Van Slyke Award in Clinical Chemistry. 1st - American Association of Clinical Chemists
Scientific Achievement Award. 1st - American Medical Association
Ames Award. American Association of Clinical Chemistry
National Medal of Science. U.S.A.
Elliott Cresson Award. Franklin Society of Philadelphia
Medal. New York Academy of Medicine
Managing Editor Journal of Biological Chemistry
American Bureau for Medical Aid to China/President
First International Congress of Biochemistry, Cambridge, Eng Honorary Vice-President
Counselor Eli Lilly Research Grants
International Congress of Clinical Chemistry, Stockholm Honorary President
Seventh Congress of Clinical Chemistry, Geneva, Switzerland Honorary President

bioghist.p: Member of: National Academy of Sciences, American Philosophical Society, American Academy of Arts and Sciences, Rudolf Virchow Medical Society in NYC, American College of Cardiology (honorary), American Society of Biological Chemists (President 1920-1922), Harvey Society (President 1927-1928), American Chemical Society, Association of American Physicians, Sigma Xi, Beta Theta Pi, Society of Experimental Biology

Honorary Member of: Soc. Chem. Biol. (Italian), Deutsche Akademie der Naturforscher, Societa Lombarda di Medicina, Academy of Science of India, Society of Biological Chemists of India, Royal Society of Sciences of Uppsala, Danish Society for Internal Medicine, SociÃ©tÃ© de Pathologie RÃ©nale, SocietÃ Italiana di Biologia Sperimentale, Association of Clinical Biochemists (Britain), Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei (Italian), Danish Academy

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Boxes 2, 3, 4 (legal size Hollinger) and oversize packages 1, 2, 3, 4 originate from the Else Van Slyke collection. Box 5 and 6 originate from the Keller Van Slyke collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.p: Includes a short biography written in 1952 at the request of U.S. Gasser for purposes of Institute history.

scopecontent.p: In folder in "Biographical file".

did.unittitle: Administrative correspondence
April-May application to RIMR and letters of recommendation
Report of the war activities of Hospital chemistry department; written at suggestion of T.M. Prudden
Correspondence regarding use of name to help raise money to use for medical supplies for China
Administrative correspondence
Correspondence with Dr. Cole and Dr. Gasser related to Aug.-Jan. leave of absence to be visiting professor at Peiping Medical College
Some personal notes. Thank you for flowers sent by Institute at death of Rena Mosher Van Slyke Some handwritten acceptances of invitations [apparatus and equipment]
List of materials/sold to Brookhaven National Laboratory from RIMR at request of Dr. Van Slyke on retirement from Institute
Oral History from a five hour audio taped interview with Dr. Van Slyke on May 27 and 28, 1969 by Peter D. Olch of History of Medicine Division, National Library of Medicine

scopecontent.p: Indexed.
Includes biography; bibliography; copy of personal history as prepared for Dr. Gasser.
